meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be a surfer but lacks skill or knowledge.
meanings.sent1: Some hodads try to fit in with real surfers at the beach.
meanings.sent2: The hodads were easy to spot with their surfboards but no surfing skills.
meanings.sent3: The hodads thought wearing a wetsuit automatically made them surf pros.
meanings.sent4: He was like a hodad in the water, all show and no surf.
meanings.sent5: The beach was full of hodads, looking lost among the waves.

meanings.definition: A tourist who frequents beaches but does not surf.
meanings.sent1: Many hodads enjoy the sun and sand without ever touching a surfboard.
meanings.sent2: The hodads lounged on the shore, content to watch the surfers from afar.
meanings.sent3: The hodads collected seashells while the surfers rode the waves.
meanings.sent4: She was a hodad at heart, preferring beachcombing to surfing.
meanings.sent5: The beach was bustling with hodads soaking up the beach vibes.

meanings.sent1: The hodads talked the talk but couldn't catch a wave to save their lives.
meanings.sent2: He was exposed as a hodad when he wiped out on the smallest wave.
meanings.sent3: The hodads strutted around in board shorts but never touched the water.
meanings.sent4: She was a hodad queen, ruling the beach with her fake surfer persona.
meanings.sent5: The beach was full of hodads, pretending to be one with the ocean.
